#Lesson Objectives / Goals      
**Upon completion of this activity, you will:**   
know how to create and write rasters    
know how to plot rasters & customize legends    
Be able to project rasters           
Be able to extract values from rasters           
Be able reclassify / resampling rasters

### Required packages    
To complete the following activity you will need the following packages installed:    
**raster**       
**sp**  
**rgeos**   
  
******       

#### Installing the packages     
`install.packages("raster")`    
`install.packages("sp")`       
`install.packages("rgeos")`

</div>
        
           
```{r,message = FALSE,warning = FALSE}
# Generate random variables #
library(raster)

x <- runif(100,min = -101, max = -100)
y <- runif(100, 43,44)
coordinates <- sp::SpatialPoints(cbind(x,y))
plot(coordinates,pch = 19)

plot(rgeos::gBuffer(coordinates, byid = TRUE, width = 0.05),add = TRUE)
```

## Does this work
```{r}
r <- raster(ncol = 10, nrow = 10)
r[] <- 1:10
```

```{r}
plot(r)
```
